biogHist.abstract: Spence ran as a South Australian delegate to the Federal Constitutional Convention in 1897, the first woman political candidate in Australia. She was also active in the Women's Suffrage League and the South Australian National Council of Women.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: National Council of Women of South Australia (1902 - )
League of Women Voters of South Australia (1909 - 1979)

descriptiveNote.p: Supported the formation of the Woman's League by her niece Lucy Morice
Fellow member of the South Australian Women's Suffrage Society
Fellow member of the South Australian Women's Suffrage League and the National Council of Women
Fellow member of the South Australian Women's Suffrage League
worked together on the Boarding-Out Society which was concerned with the plight of orphaned and neglected children
Jeanne Young joined Catherine Helen Spence in campaigning for proportional representation and completed Spence's autobiography (in the first person) after her death.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Spence, Catherine Helen, 1825-1910. Papers

archref.repository: Mitchell and Dixson Libraries Manuscripts Collection, State Library of New South Wales
archref.abstract: Talks, articles and research notes, 1861-1907; poems; correspondence 1856-1909; newspaper cuttings and proofsheets, printed material re South African War, 1899-1902.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Papers of Catherine Helen Spence 1853-1900

archref.repository: National Library of Australia Manuscript Collection
archref.abstract: 1. Anonymous letter to Smith Elder & Co., 1853. 2. Estimate of character of C. H. Spence. 3. Letter to editor of Cornill Magazine, 1873. 4. Holograph postcard to Miss Windeyer. 5. Letter from E. Nanson to Miss Spence. 6. Letter from Emily Clark to Lady Windeyer. 7. Letter from Emily Clark to Henry Parkes.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Papers of Catherine Helen Spence 1825-1910

archref.repository: National Library of Australia Manuscript Collection
archref.abstract: Contents: 1. Talks, articles and research notes, 1961-1907. 2. Poems. 3. Correspondence, 1856-1909. 4. Newspaper cuttings and proof sheets, 1876-1907. 5. Printed material re the South African War, 1899-1902.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Papers of Catherine Helen Spence.

archref.repository: State Library of South Australia, Mortlock Library of South Australiana
archref.abstract: Records of Catherine Helen Spence comprising manuscripts of sermons, articles written for publication, lectures, scrapbooks, and the text of an unpublished novel, also reminiscences of and by Miss Spence.

archref.repository: State Library of South Australia, Mortlock Library of South Australiana
archref.unittitle: The Grand Old Woman of Australia (literary manuscript)
archref.abstract: Manuscript of J.F. Young's biography of Catherine Helen Spence 'The Grand Old Woman of Australia'.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Speech re Catherine Helen Spence

archref.repository: State Library of South Australia, Mortlock Library of South Australiana
archref.abstract: Speech given at the launch of the book 'Tenacious of the Past: The Recollections of Helen Brodie'. 19 December 1994.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Unitarian Christian Church Adelaide: SUMMARY RECORD

archref.repository: State Library of South Australia, Mortlock Library of South Australiana
archref.unittitle: Unitarian Christian Church Adelaide: SUMMARY RECORD
archref.abstract: Records of the Unitarian Christian Church, Wakefield Street, Adelaide and Osmond Terrace, Norwood, and Tranmere, comprising minutes, annual reports, church calendars, correspondence, marriage registers, membership register, cash books and financial records, indenture of land sale, photographs, newspaper cuttings, memorandum, abstracts from minutes, subscription lists for erection of church, list of seat rents, trust deeds, rules and constitutions, library catalogues, orders of service, sermons and lectures, posters, architectural plans, and printed material. Church goers included Catherine Helen Spence. Series 6 - Papers of the League of Unitarian and other Liberal Christian Women (Adelaide Branch) including minute books. Series 8 - Membership register for the Adelaide League of Liberal Christian Women (1912-1953)
